title.narrative: The Programme For Emergency Assistance To Poor And Vulnerable Community In Ethnic Minority Areas And Yangon

description.narrative:
The overall objective of the project is helping Myanmar's poor and vulnerable communities affected by conflicts and natural disasters to address the emergency needs to restore their normal life and to sustainably improve quality of life through improvement of housing conditions and enhancing access to community infrastructure.The project has specific objective of assisting vulnerable communities, mostly women and children, to respond to unexpected disaster conditions through all project activities, promoting active participation of women, immediate recovery of vulnerable communities' economic and social actions and providing safer and healthy environment for children.The target population of the component one includes families currently living in squatter conditions and disaster prone area in Yangon –who will qualify the stringent criteria of beneficiary selection carried by Department of Human Settlement and Housing Development /Yangon City Development Committee (YCDC) and UN-Habitat. These families will be directly benefited from the housing intervention which facilitate through people's process to build houses for them.The target population of the component two includes communities in the conflict affected deprived villages in Mansi township (30 villages) and Momauk township (30 villages) in Kachin State and Pekkon township (50 villages) in Shan State. Under this communities will be facilitated and empowered to construct, rehabilitate most needy community infrastructure which contributes to enhance their normal life.Beneficiary selection for component one will be on criteria based assessment so that the project interventions will yield best impact and optimum results and reach out to the most vulnerable and deserving families. Therefore beneficiaries for the proposed housing component will be selected byDepartment of Human Settlement and Housing Development/Yangon City Development Committee (YCDC) and UN-Habitat using the stringent selection criteria developed by UN-Habitat in consultation with Department of Human Settlement and Housing Development/YCDC. Selected beneficiaries will be only from project catchment area. Before the beneficiary selection UN-Habitat will conduct a detailed household survey in the three project target locations which results will be analyzed to further on used to verify against the beneficiary application and selection.The target population of the component two will be selected based on: a) Villages where people's urgent needs are not met as per township authorities , b) Villages which at least more that 50% household do not have easy access to safe drinking water, c) Villages which at least more than 50% do not have individual access to adequate sanitation, d) Villages which do not have or have dilapidated and affected by conflict basic infrastructure, e) Villages which have reasonable number of household and total population (i.e. 40HH, 200 population), f) Villages where there are no means and ways of getting health facilities, education facilities, inter / intra villages access roads, g) Villages where there is high interest of community participation, h) Villages where there is potential for growth but no initiatives or investment plans of both Department of Rural Development (DRD) and other development partnersExpected outcomes of the project are:Vulnerable communities in squatter condition and disaster prone areas of Yangon rebuilt their dilapidated houses where safety and living conditions of mainly women and children are improved with better housing conditions, and ensured land tenure rightsConnectivity restored and condition improved of basic infrastructure in affected rural communities and regained access to market, health and educational facilitiesIncreased access to safe drinking water and reduced incidence of water borne diseases among affected communitiesIncreased access to adequate sanitation and promoted good hygiene practicesLivelihood opportunities through employment-intensive improved; the employment-intensive component will contribute to the poorest households to start up sustainable livelihood by injecting cash into local communities.Capacity building will impact in the process of community development as well in ensuring that communities will fully engage with future improvement activities for their communities; capacity building will also provide better job opportunities.The project partners are Yangon City Development Committee (YCDC), Village Development Committee (VDC) in each village (Kachin and Shan), Community Development Committee (CDC) (Yangon), State and Township Authorities, Department of Rural Development (DRD), Ministry of Social Welfare, Relief and Resettlement (MOSWRR)
The project actions are designed and implemented The proposed actions are based on UN-Habitat experience in response activities carried out immediately after Cyclone Nargis and Cyclone Giri. After Nargis, UN-Habitat was the shelter cluster lead and supported emergency shelter coordination and implemented shelter reconstruction with water and sanitation facilities, in addition community infrastructure was also either constructed or renovated (Please see Annex 2). UN-Habitat has successfully implemented number of community driven shelter recovery projects in the Asia Pacific region over the last two decades and has gained enormous experience. Through the UN-Habitat Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific (ROAP) in Fukuoka, the project will obtain support and guidance sharing lessons learnt from the region during planning and implementing the project activities in additions to the regional office supervision.

department.narrative: Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific
